info.name: Scan2Card API Collection
info.description: Complete API collection for Scan2Card backend application with in-app notifications and Firebase Cloud Messaging support

item.name: Crawler Service

request.description: Check crawler service health status

Crawl a URL to extract contact information from digital business cards. This service uses Puppeteer to scrape webpage content and extract structured contact data.

**Request Body:**
- `url` (required, string): The URL to crawl and extract data from

**Response:**
Returns extracted contact information including:
- firstName, lastName
- company, position, department
- email, phoneNumber, mobile
- website, address, streetName, city, country
- title, uniqueCode

**Rate Limiting:** 100 requests per 15 minutes per IP

**Timeout:** 45 seconds (configurable)

**Use Cases:**
- Extract contact information from digital business card URLs in QR codes
- Automated lead capture from web-based business cards
- Integration with QR code scanning workflow

item.description: Crawler microservice for web scraping digital business cards from URLs

item.name: Authentication

request.description: Register a new user (EXHIBITOR, ENDUSER, TEAMMANAGER)
Login with email and password. Returns JWT token or OTP requirement.

Refresh access token using refresh token to prevent user logout.

**Authentication Required:** None (Public endpoint)

**Purpose:**
Prevents users from getting logged out when their access token expires during active usage. The frontend should call this endpoint automatically before the access token expires.

**Request Body:**
- `refreshToken` (required, string): The refresh token received during login

**How It Works:**
1. Login returns both `token` (access token, 15min) and `refreshToken` (7 days)
2. Frontend uses access token for all API requests
3. Before access token expires, frontend calls this endpoint with refresh token
4. Backend validates refresh token and issues new access token
5. User stays logged in without re-entering credentials

**Token Lifetimes:**
- Access Token: 15 minutes (configurable via JWT_ACCESS_TOKEN_EXPIRES_IN)
- Refresh Token: 7 days (configurable via JWT_REFRESH_TOKEN_EXPIRES_IN)

**Response:**
- Success: Returns new access token with same user data
  ```json
  {
    "success": true,
    "message": "Access token refreshed successfully",
    "data": {
      "token": "new_access_token_here",
      "expiresIn": "15m",
      "user": { ... }
    }
  }
  ```
- Error 400: Invalid refresh token format
- Error 401: Refresh token expired (user must login again)

**Frontend Implementation:**
Store both tokens after login:
```javascript
const { token, refreshToken } = response.data;
localStorage.setItem('accessToken', token);
localStorage.setItem('refreshToken', refreshToken);
```

Set up automatic token refresh:
```javascript
// Refresh 1 minute before expiry (14 min for 15min token)
setTimeout(() => {
  refreshAccessToken();
}, 14 * 60 * 1000);
```

**Security Notes:**
- Refresh tokens are stored in database (can be revoked)
- Each refresh token can only be used by the user who owns it
- Refresh tokens expire after 7 days of inactivity
- If refresh token expires, user must login again

**Rate Limiting:** 1000 requests per 15 minutes per IP (loginIPLimiter)

**Unified OTP Verification Endpoint**

Single endpoint for all OTP verification types. Supports optional `type` parameter.

**Authentication Required:** None (Public endpoint)

**Request Body:**
- `userId` (required, string): User ID to verify
- `otp` (required, string): 6-digit OTP code
- `type` (optional, string): Verification type - "login" | "verification" | "forgot_password"
  - Defaults to "login" if not provided (backward compatible)

**Usage Examples:**

**1. User Verification (after registration):**
```json
{
  "userId": "507f1f77bcf86cd799439011",
  "otp": "123456",
  "type": "verification"
}
```
**Response:** Returns JWT tokens (token, refreshToken) and user data - user is now logged in automatically after verification
```json
{
  "success": true,
  "message": "User verified successfully",
  "data": {
    "token": "eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIs...",
    "refreshToken": "eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIs...",
    "expiresIn": "24h",
    "user": { "_id": "...", "email": "...", "role": "...", "isVerified": true }
  }
}
```

**2. Login 2FA:**
```json
{
  "userId": "507f1f77bcf86cd799439011",
  "otp": "123456",
  "type": "login"
}
```
**Response:** Returns JWT tokens (token, refreshToken) and user data for authentication

**3. Forgot Password (Step 2 of password reset flow):**
```json
{
  "userId": "507f1f77bcf86cd799439011",
  "otp": "123456",
  "type": "forgot_password"
}
```
**Response:** Returns `verificationToken` (valid 10 minutes) to be used in Step 3
```json
{
  "success": true,
  "message": "OTP verified. You may now reset your password",
  "data": {
    "userId": "507f1f77bcf86cd799439011",
    "verificationToken": "eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIs..."
  }
}
```
**Next Step:** Use this `verificationToken` in `/reset-password` endpoint

**4. Backward Compatible (defaults to login):**
```json
{
  "userId": "507f1f77bcf86cd799439011",
  "otp": "123456"
}
```
**Response:** Same as type="login"

**Development Mode:**
- Test OTP: 000000 (when USE_DUMMY_OTP=true)
- Master OTP works for all types

**Security Features:**
- OTP expires after 10 minutes
- Single-use only
- Type-specific rate limiting
- Verification token (for forgot_password) expires in 10 minutes

**Rate Limiting:**
- login/verification: 10 attempts per 15 minutes
- forgot_password: 3 attempts per hour

**Error Responses:**
- 400: Missing required fields or invalid type
- 400: Invalid/expired/used OTP
- 429: Rate limit exceeded
Send OTP for user verification. Required after registration to verify the account. (Test OTP: 000000)
Verify user with OTP. Sets isVerified to true. (Test OTP: 000000)

**Step 1 of Forgot Password Flow** - Initiate password reset and send OTP.

**Authentication Required:** None (Public endpoint)

**Request Body:**
- `email` (required, string): User's registered email address

**Process Flow:**
1. System verifies email exists in database
2. Generates 6-digit OTP and sends via SMS to user's registered phone
3. Returns userId needed for subsequent steps
4. OTP expires after 10 minutes

**Rate Limiting:**
- 5 requests per hour per email (otpSendResourceLimiter)
- 500 requests per hour per IP (otpSendIPLimiter)

**Response:**
- Success: Returns `userId` and confirmation message
- Error 400: Invalid email format
- Error 404: Email not found in system
- Error 429: Rate limit exceeded (too many attempts)

**Development Mode:**
- When `USE_DUMMY_OTP=true`, test OTP is 000000
- No actual SMS sent in development mode

**Next Steps:**
1. **Step 2:** Call `/verify-otp` with `{ userId, otp, type: "forgot_password" }` to get `verificationToken`
2. **Step 3:** Call `/reset-password` with `{ userId, verificationToken, newPassword }` to complete reset

**Step 3 of Forgot Password Flow** - Complete password reset with verification token.

**Authentication Required:** None (Public endpoint)

**Complete Forgot Password Flow:**
1. **Step 1:** POST `/forgot-password` with `{ email }` → Sends OTP, returns `userId`
2. **Step 2:** POST `/verify-otp` with `{ userId, otp, type: "forgot_password" }` → Returns `verificationToken` (10-min validity)
3. **Step 3:** POST `/reset-password` with `{ userId, verificationToken, newPassword }` → Resets password ✅

**Request Body:**
- `userId` (required, string): User ID from Step 1
- `verificationToken` (required, string): Verification token received from Step 2 after OTP verification
- `newPassword` (required, string): New password to set (minimum 6 characters)

**Process:**
1. Validates verification token (JWT with 10-minute expiry)
2. Ensures token hasn't been used for password reset already
3. Validates new password meets security requirements
4. Updates user password in database
5. Expires the verification token (one-time use)
6. Returns success confirmation

**Password Requirements:**
- Minimum 6 characters
- Should contain a mix of characters for security

**Rate Limiting:**
- 3 requests per hour per email (passwordResetEmailLimiter)
- 200 requests per hour per IP (passwordResetIPLimiter)

**Response:**
- Success: `{ success: true, message: "Password reset successfully", data: { email } }`
- Error 400: Invalid/expired verification token, or password requirements not met
- Error 404: User not found
- Error 429: Rate limit exceeded

**Security Notes:**
- Verification token expires after 10 minutes
- Token can only be used once
- Separate from OTP - provides additional security layer
- Failed attempts count towards rate limiting

Change password for authenticated users without OTP verification.

**Authentication Required:** Bearer token

**Request Body:**
- `currentPassword` (required, string): User's current password for verification
- `newPassword` (required, string): New password to set

**Process Flow:**
1. Verifies authentication token is valid
2. Verifies current password matches user's existing password
3. Validates new password meets security requirements
4. Updates password in database
5. Returns success confirmation

**Password Requirements:**
- Minimum length varies by system configuration
- Should contain a mix of characters for security
- Must be different from current password

**Rate Limiting:** 30 requests per minute per user (profileWriteLimiter)

**Response:**
- Success: Returns success message confirming password change
- Error 400: Invalid current password or password requirements not met
- Error 401: Invalid or missing authentication token
- Error 429: Rate limit exceeded

**Note:** This endpoint is also available at `/profile/change-password` with identical functionality.

**Use Cases:**
- User wants to change password while logged in
- Regular password rotation for security
- No OTP required since user is already authenticated
Get current user profile (requires authentication)

Logout user and invalidate refresh token.

**Authentication Required:** Bearer token

**Functionality:**
- Invalidates the user's refresh token by clearing it from the database
- Prevents the refresh token from being used to generate new access tokens
- User must login again to get a new access token and refresh token

**Rate Limiting:** 30 requests per minute per user (profileWriteLimiter)

**Response:**
- Success: Returns success message confirming logout
- Error 401: Invalid or missing authentication token
- Error 429: Rate limit exceeded

**Best Practices:**
- Call this endpoint when user clicks logout button
- Clear the access token and refresh token from client storage after successful logout
- Redirect user to login page after logout

**Use Cases:**
- User wants to logout from the application
- Security measure to invalidate refresh token on logout
- Prevents unauthorized access after logout

Soft delete user account with PII anonymization.

**Authentication Required:** Bearer token

**Functionality:**
- Soft deletes the user account (sets isDeleted: true, isActive: false)
- Anonymizes personal data for privacy compliance:
  - Name changed to "Scan2Card User"
  - Phone number replaced with placeholder
  - Email replaced with placeholder
  - Profile image removed
- Clears authentication tokens (refresh token, FCM tokens)
- Preserves user's created data (leads, etc.) for admin visibility

**Rate Limiting:** 30 requests per minute per user (profileWriteLimiter)

**Response:**
- Success 200: { success: true, message: "Account deleted successfully" }
- Error 401: Invalid or missing authentication token
- Error 400: Account already deleted
- Error 404: User not found

**Important Notes:**
- This action is irreversible from the user's perspective
- Data created by the user remains visible to team admins
- User will see "Scan2Card User" instead of actual name in records

item.name: RSVP

request.description: Validate a license key before creating RSVP

Filter to show only active RSVPs/registrations (true/false, default: false)

request.description:
Get all RSVPs for authenticated user.

**Query Parameters:**
- `page` (optional): Page number for pagination (default: 1)
- `limit` (optional): Number of items per page (default: 10)
- `search` (optional): Search by event name, type, venue, or city
- `activeOnly` (optional): Filter to show only active RSVPs/registrations where user hasn't cancelled (true/false, default: false)

**Trial Event Auto-Join:**
When a new end user calls this endpoint for the first time (with no existing RSVPs), they are automatically joined to a trial event. This allows them to create up to 5 leads without a license key. The trial event will appear in the response with `isTrialEvent: true`.
Get single RSVP details
Cancel an RSVP
Get all RSVPs for a specific event (EXHIBITOR only)

request.description:
Scan a business card using either image or OCR text to extract contact information. Supports both image-based vision API processing and direct OCR text analysis with front and back card support.

**Request Body Options:**

1. **Image Processing:**
   - `image` (required, string): Base64-encoded image data with data URI prefix
     - Format: `data:image/jpeg;base64,<base64_string>`
     - Supported formats: JPEG, PNG, WebP
     - Max size: 20MB

2. **OCR Text Processing (Front & Back):**
   - `frontOcrText` (required, string): Raw OCR-extracted text from front of business card
   - `backOcrText` (optional, string): Raw OCR-extracted text from back of business card
   - `isOCRText` (optional, boolean): Set to `true` for OCR text processing

**Processing Flow:**
- **Image Mode:** Uses OpenAI GPT-4o Mini (primary) with Gemini 2.5 Flash fallback to analyze image and extract structured data
- **OCR Mode:** Combines front and back text, then uses Gemini 2.5 Flash (primary) with OpenAI GPT-4o Mini fallback to parse and convert to structured JSON

**Response:**
Returns extracted contact information with ALL fields present (empty strings for missing data):
- firstName, lastName
- company, position
- email, phoneNumber
- website, address, city, country
- notes
- frontOcrText, backOcrText (for OCR mode)

**Note:** The following fields are NOT supported and will not be returned:
- fax
- zipCode
- department
- mobile
- streetName
- title
- uniqueCode

response.name: Image Scan Success
response.body:
{
    "success": true,
    "message": "Business card scanned successfully",
    "data": {
        "scannedCardImage": "data:image/jpeg;base64,/9j/4AAQSkZJRg...",
        "frontOcrText": null,
        "backOcrText": null,
        "details": {
            "firstName": "John",
            "lastName": "Doe",
            "company": "Tech Corp",
            "position": "CEO",
            "email": "john.doe@example.com",
            "phoneNumber": "+1234567890",
            "website": "https://techcorp.com",
            "address": "123 Business St",
            "city": "New York",
            "country": "USA",
            "notes": ""
        },
        "confidence": 0.83,
        "processingMethod": "image_vision_api"
    }
}

request.description:
Scan a digital business card QR code to extract entry code or contact information. Returns structured data for lead creation.

**Request Body:**
- `qrText` (required, string): The decoded text from QR code

**Processing Flow:**
1. **vCard Format:** If QR text is vCard format, parses contact fields directly
2. **URL Format:** If QR text is a URL, sends to CrawlerService to scrape webpage and extract contact data
3. **Entry Code:** If neither vCard nor URL, treats as entry code for organizational QR cards

**Response:**
Returns structured contact data:
- entryCode: Unique entry code (if applicable)
- contactData: Extracted contact fields
  - firstName, lastName
  - company, position, department
  - email, phoneNumber, mobile
  - website, address, streetName, city, country
  - title, uniqueCode

**Crawler Service Integration:**
When QR code contains a URL, this endpoint calls the CrawlerService microservice (port 3001) to:
- Load the webpage using Puppeteer
- Extract contact information from HTML
- Parse structured data (schema.org, microformats)
- Return normalized contact object

**Note:** The following fields are NOT supported:
- fax
- zipCode
- notes

formdata.value: {"firstName":"John","lastName":"Doe","emails":["john.doe@example.com"],"phoneNumbers":["+1234567890"],"company":"Acme Corp","position":"CEO","website":"https://acme.com","address":"123 Business St","city":"San Francisco","country":"USA","notes":{"text":"Met at conference booth, interested in enterprise plan"}}

formdata.description: Audio note file (MP3, M4A, AAC, WebM, WAV, OGG, 3GP, AMR - supports mobile recordings, max 10MB)

request.description:
Create a new lead (ENDUSER or EXHIBITOR). Use scan-card or scan-qr endpoints first to extract data.

**Request Body (multipart/form-data):**
- `eventId` (optional): Event ID to associate lead with
- `isIndependentLead` (optional, boolean): Whether lead is independent of events
- `leadType` (required): Type of lead capture
  - `full_scan`: Scanned business card with image
  - `entry_code`: Digital business card with entry code
  - `manual`: Manually entered lead
- `entryCode` (optional): Entry code from organizational QR cards
- `ocrText` (optional): Extracted OCR text from card
- `details` (optional, JSON string): Contact information object
  - Available fields: firstName, lastName, company, position, **emails** (array), **phoneNumbers** (array), website, address, city, country, **notes** (object)
- `rating` (optional, number): Lead quality rating (1-5)
- `images` (optional, file[]): Business card images (max 3 images)
- `noteAudio` (optional, file): Audio note recording (MP3, M4A, AAC, WebM, WAV, OGG, 3GP, AMR - supports mobile recordings, max 10MB)
- `allowDuplicate` (optional, boolean): Skip duplicate check (default: false)

**Notes Field Format:**
The `notes` field in details supports both text and audio:
```json
{
  "notes": {
    "text": "Optional text note about the lead",
    "audioUrl": "S3 URL (auto-populated when noteAudio file is uploaded)"
  }
}
```
You can provide text notes in the details JSON, and/or upload an audio file via the `noteAudio` field. The audio URL will be automatically added to notes.audioUrl.

**Duplicate Detection:**
System checks for existing leads matching **ANY email** OR **ANY phone** OR **entryCode** within the same event. If found, returns 409 Conflict.

**Note:** While the QR/card scanning endpoints don't return a `rating` field (you rate leads manually), the lead model itself still supports the `rating` field for tracking lead quality.

**Trial Event Limit:**
If creating a lead with a trial event, users are limited to 5 leads. After reaching this limit, they must join a regular event with a license key to continue creating leads. Check trial status with GET /leads/trial-status.

query.description: Search by name, company, email, phone
Filter by time period: today | weekly | earlier
Filter by license key/stall (returns leads from users with this license key)
Filter leads where user can create meetings (true). Checks RSVP and license key permissions.

request.description:
Get all leads for authenticated user with pagination and filters.

**Query Parameters:**
- `page` (number): Page number (default: 1)
- `limit` (number): Items per page (default: 10)
- `eventId` (string): Filter by specific event
- `isIndependentLead` (boolean): Filter independent leads
- `search` (string): Search by name, company, email, or phone
- `minimal` (boolean): Return minimal data without populated refs
- `period` (string): Filter by time period (new feature)
  - `today`: Leads created today (00:00-23:59 in user's timezone)
  - `weekly`: Leads created this week excluding today (Monday-Sunday)
  - `earlier`: Leads created before this week
- `timeZone` (string): IANA timezone for period filtering (default: Asia/Kolkata)
  - Examples: Asia/Kolkata, America/New_York, Europe/London, UTC
- `licenseKey` (string): Filter leads by license key/stall
- `canCreateMeeting` (boolean): Filter leads where user can create meetings
  - When `true`, only returns leads from events where meeting creation is allowed
  - Checks individual RSVP permission (`canCreateMeeting` field)
  - Checks license key bulk permission (`allowTeamMeetings` field)
  - Individual RSVP permission takes priority over license key setting

**Time-based Filtering:**
The `period` parameter enables timezone-aware lead filtering:
- MongoDB stores all timestamps in UTC
- The API converts your timezone to UTC for accurate queries
- Week starts on Monday and ends on Sunday
- Default timezone is Asia/Kolkata (Indian Standard Time)

**Meeting Permission Logic:**
When `canCreateMeeting=true`:
1. If RSVP has `canCreateMeeting=false` → event excluded
2. If RSVP has `canCreateMeeting=true` → event included (individual override)
3. Otherwise, if license key has `allowTeamMeetings=false` → event excluded
4. If no restrictions → event included

**Sorting:**
Leads are sorted by creation date in descending order (newest first).

**Response:**
Returns paginated list of leads with metadata.
Get lead statistics
Get lead statistics grouped by period. Use filter=weekly|monthly|yearly and optional timeZone (IANA).

Get user's trial event status including:
- Trial leads used (out of 5 maximum)
- Remaining trial leads available
- Whether trial is still active
- Trial event details

**Trial Event Feature:**
New end users are automatically joined to a trial event when they first access their RSVPs. Users can create up to 5 leads with the trial event without needing a license key. After 5 leads, they must join a regular event with a license key to continue.

**Response Example:**
```json
{
  "success": true,
  "data": {
    "trialLeadsUsed": 2,
    "remainingTrialLeads": 3,
    "maxTrialLeads": 5,
    "isTrialActive": true,
    "hasJoinedTrialEvent": true,
    "trialEvent": {
      "id": "674f2a1e5b8c9d001a2b3c4d",
      "name": "Trial Event - Get Started with Scan2Card",
      "description": "Welcome! Use this trial event to explore..."
    }
  }
}
```
Get single lead by ID

formdata.description: Audio note file (MP3, M4A, AAC, WebM, WAV, OGG, 3GP, AMR - supports mobile recordings, max 10MB)
Set to 'true' to remove existing audio note (ignored if noteAudio file is provided)

request.description:
Update lead information. Supports both JSON and multipart/form-data.

**IMPORTANT: Contact fields must be nested inside `details` object!**

**Request Body (multipart/form-data - all fields optional):**

**Top-level fields:**
- `eventId` (string): Event ID to associate lead with
- `isIndependentLead` (boolean): Whether lead is independent
- `leadType` (string): Type of lead (full_scan, entry_code, manual)
- `entryCode` (string): Entry code
- `rating` (number): Lead quality rating (1-5)
- `isActive` (boolean): Whether lead is active
- `images` (array): Array of S3 image URLs (max 3)
- `noteAudio` (file): Audio note file to upload (replaces existing audio)
- `removeAudio` (boolean): Set to 'true' to remove existing audio note

**Audio Note Management:**
- To **add/replace** audio: Upload a file via `noteAudio` field
- To **remove** existing audio: Set `removeAudio=true` (without uploading a file)
- To **keep** existing audio: Don't include either field

**Supported Audio Formats:** MP3, M4A, AAC, WebM, WAV, OGG, 3GP, AMR (max 10MB)

**Contact details (nested inside `details` JSON string):**
- `details.firstName` (string): First name
- `details.lastName` (string): Last name
- `details.company` (string): Company name
- `details.position` (string): Job position
- `details.email` (string): Email address
- `details.phoneNumber` (string): Phone number
- `details.website` (string): Website URL
- `details.address` (string): Street address
- `details.city` (string): City
- `details.country` (string): Country
- `details.notes` (object): { text: string, audioUrl: string }

**Example - Update with new audio:**
```
PUT /leads/:id
Content-Type: multipart/form-data

details: {"firstName": "John", "notes": {"text": "Voice note attached"}}
noteAudio: [audio file]
```

**Example - Remove existing audio:**
```
PUT /leads/:id
Content-Type: multipart/form-data

details: {"notes": {"text": "Audio removed"}}
removeAudio: true
```

query.description: Filter by event ID or 'all' for all events

request.description:
Export leads to CSV with full data.

**Authentication Required:** Bearer token

**Roles:** ENDUSER or EXHIBITOR

**What Data is Exported:**
- **ENDUSER**: Exports all leads scanned by the authenticated user
- **EXHIBITOR**: Exports all leads from events owned by the exhibitor

**Query Parameters:**
- `eventId` (optional): Filter by specific event ID, or use 'all' for all events
- `search` (optional): Search filter for name, company, email, or phone
- `rating` (optional): Filter by rating (1-5)

**Export Format:** CSV file with 13 columns:
1. Entry Code
2. First Name
3. Last Name
4. Company
5. Position
6. Email
7. Phone Number
8. Website
9. City
10. Country
11. Event
12. Lead Type
13. Rating
14. Created Date

**Removed Columns (compared to previous versions):**
- Notes (field removed from schema)
- Fax (not supported)
- ZipCode (not supported)

**Response:** JSON with S3 URL (Changed from direct CSV download)
```json
{
  "success": true,
  "message": "Leads exported successfully",
  "data": {
    "url": "https://bucket.s3.region.amazonaws.com/csv-exports/leads-export-2025-12-08-uuid.csv",
    "filename": "leads-export-2025-12-08.csv",
    "key": "csv-exports/leads-export-2025-12-08-uuid.csv",
    "size": 1234,
    "leadsCount": 50
  }
}
```

**Frontend Implementation:**
The frontend should download the CSV from the provided S3 URL:
```javascript
const response = await axios.get('/leads/export', { params });
const { url, filename } = response.data.data;
window.open(url, '_blank'); // Download from S3
```

**Storage:**
- CSV files are stored in S3 bucket under `csv-exports/` folder
- Files are publicly accessible
- Maximum 1000 leads per export

**Use Cases:**
- Export all leads for CRM import
- Download leads for offline analysis
- Backup lead data
- Share leads with team members

query.description: Export type: 'entryOnly' for entry codes only
Filter by event ID or 'all' for all events

request.description:
Export only entry codes to CSV (1 column).

**Authentication Required:** Bearer token

**Roles:** ENDUSER or EXHIBITOR

**What Data is Exported:**
- **ENDUSER**: Exports entry codes of leads scanned by the authenticated user
- **EXHIBITOR**: Exports entry codes from leads in events owned by the exhibitor

**Important:** Only leads with entry codes will be included in the export. Leads without entry codes are filtered out automatically.

**Query Parameters:**
- `type` (required): Must be 'entryOnly' for entry code export
- `eventId` (optional): Filter by specific event ID, or use 'all' for all events
- `search` (optional): Search filter
- `rating` (optional): Filter by rating (1-5)

**Export Format:** CSV file with 1 column:
1. Entry Code

**Example CSV Output:**
```
Entry Code
ABC123XYZ456
DEF789GHI012
JKL345MNO678
```

**Response:** JSON with S3 URL (Changed from direct CSV download)
```json
{
  "success": true,
  "message": "Leads exported successfully",
  "data": {
    "url": "https://bucket.s3.region.amazonaws.com/csv-exports/entry-codes-2025-12-08-uuid.csv",
    "filename": "entry-codes-2025-12-08.csv",
    "key": "csv-exports/entry-codes-2025-12-08-uuid.csv",
    "size": 456,
    "leadsCount": 25
  }
}
```

**Frontend Implementation:**
The frontend should download the CSV from the provided S3 URL:
```javascript
const response = await axios.get('/leads/export?type=entryOnly', { params });
const { url, filename } = response.data.data;
window.open(url, '_blank'); // Download from S3
```

**Storage:**
- CSV files are stored in S3 bucket under `csv-exports/` folder
- Files are publicly accessible
- Only includes leads that have non-empty entry codes
- Maximum 1000 leads per export

**Use Cases:**
- Quick export of entry codes for lookup systems
- Minimal data export for privacy-sensitive scenarios
- Integration with entry code validation systems
- Bulk entry code verification

Soft delete a lead.

**Trial Event Note:**
If deleting a lead created with a trial event, the trial lead counter will be decremented, allowing the user to create another trial lead.

body.raw:
{
  "eventId": "674f2a1e5b8c9d001a2b3c4e",
  "title": "Product Demo Meeting",
  "description": "Demonstration of new product features and Q&A session",
  "meetingMode": "online",
  "startAt": "2025-12-15T14:30:00.000Z",
  "endAt": "2025-12-15T15:30:00.000Z",
  "location": "https://meet.google.com/abc-defg-hij",
  "notifyAttendees": true
}

request.description:
Create a new meeting with a lead (ENDUSER only).

**Required Fields:**
- `leadId` (string): ID of the lead for this meeting
- `title` (string): Meeting title
- `meetingMode` (string): One of: 'online', 'offline', 'phone'
- `startAt` (string): Meeting start time in UTC (ISO 8601 format: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ss.sssZ)
- `endAt` (string): Meeting end time in UTC (ISO 8601 format: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ss.sssZ)

**Optional Fields:**
- `eventId` (string): ID of associated event
- `description` (string): Meeting description/agenda
- `location` (string): Meeting location (address for offline, link for online)
- `notifyAttendees` (boolean): Whether to notify attendees (default: false)

**Meeting Modes:**
- `online`: Virtual meeting (provide meeting link in location)
- `offline`: In-person meeting (provide venue address in location)
- `phone`: Phone call (provide phone number in location)

**UTC Timestamps:**
- All times are stored in UTC (24-hour format)
- Example: 2025-12-15T14:30:00.000Z = Dec 15, 2025 at 2:30 PM UTC
- Frontend should convert user's local time to UTC before sending
- startAt must be before endAt

**Response:**
Returns the created meeting object with status 'scheduled'.

query.description: Filter by status: scheduled, completed, cancelled, rescheduled
Filter by mode: online, offline, phone

request.description:
Get all meetings for authenticated user with pagination and filters.

**Query Parameters:**
- `page` (number): Page number (default: 1)
- `limit` (number): Items per page (default: 10)
- `leadId` (string): Filter by specific lead
- `eventId` (string): Filter by specific event
- `meetingStatus` (string): Filter by status (scheduled, completed, cancelled, rescheduled)
- `meetingMode` (string): Filter by mode (online, offline, phone)

**Response:**
Returns paginated list of meetings sorted by startAt (earliest first).
Each meeting includes populated lead details and event info.
Get single meeting by ID

body.raw:
{
  "title": "Rescheduled Product Demo",
  "description": "Updated meeting agenda with additional topics",
  "meetingMode": "offline",
  "meetingStatus": "rescheduled",
  "startAt": "2025-12-16T10:00:00.000Z",
  "endAt": "2025-12-16T11:30:00.000Z",
  "location": "Conference Room B, Building 2",
  "notifyAttendees": true,
  "isActive": true
}

request.description:
Update meeting details (ENDUSER only - must own the meeting).

**All Fields Optional:**
- `title` (string): Meeting title
- `description` (string): Meeting description/agenda
- `meetingMode` (string): 'online', 'offline', or 'phone'
- `meetingStatus` (string): 'scheduled', 'completed', 'cancelled', or 'rescheduled'
- `startAt` (string): Meeting start time in UTC (ISO 8601 format)
- `endAt` (string): Meeting end time in UTC (ISO 8601 format)
- `location` (string): Meeting location/link
- `notifyAttendees` (boolean): Whether to notify attendees
- `isActive` (boolean): Whether meeting is active

**Meeting Status Values:**
- `scheduled`: Meeting is scheduled and confirmed
- `completed`: Meeting has been completed
- `cancelled`: Meeting has been cancelled
- `rescheduled`: Meeting has been rescheduled

**Validation:**
- If both startAt and endAt are provided, startAt must be before endAt
- All timestamps must be in UTC ISO 8601 format

**Response:**
Returns the updated meeting object with populated lead and event details.

Soft delete a meeting (ENDUSER only - must own the meeting).

This performs a soft delete by setting isDeleted=true.
The meeting will no longer appear in GET requests but remains in the database.

**Response:**
Returns success message confirming deletion.

Get current user profile with full details.

**Authentication Required:** Bearer token in Authorization header

**Response:** Returns user object including:
- Personal info (firstName, lastName, email, phoneNumber)
- Account info (role, isVerified, isActive, is2FAEnabled)
- Company info (companyName, address for exhibitors)
- Profile image (profileImageUrl if uploaded)
- Timestamps (createdAt, updatedAt)

Update user profile information (without file upload).

**Authentication Required:** Bearer token

**Optional Fields:**
- `firstName` (string): User's first name
- `lastName` (string): User's last name
- `phoneNumber` (string): Phone number with country code
- `companyName` (string): Company name (for exhibitors)
- `address` (string): Business address
- `profileImage` (string): Base64 encoded image or S3 URL

**Response:** Returns updated user profile

formdata.description: Profile image file (JPEG, PNG, GIF, WebP - max 10MB)

request.description:
Update user profile with profile image upload.

**Authentication Required:** Bearer token

**Content-Type:** multipart/form-data

**Form Fields:**
- `firstName` (optional): User's first name
- `lastName` (optional): User's last name
- `phoneNumber` (optional): Phone number
- `companyName` (optional): Company name
- `address` (optional): Business address
- `profileImage` (optional): Profile image file

**Image Requirements:**
- Formats: JPEG, PNG, GIF, WebP
- Max size: 10MB
- Uploaded to S3 and URL saved in profile

**Response:** Returns updated user profile with profileImageUrl

Change password for authenticated users.

**Authentication Required:** Bearer token

**Request Body:**
- `currentPassword` (required, string): User's current password for verification
- `newPassword` (required, string): New password to set

**Password Requirements:**
- Minimum length varies by system configuration
- Should contain a mix of characters for security

**Validation:**
- Current password must match the user's existing password
- New password must be different from current password
- New password must meet security requirements

**Rate Limiting:** 30 requests per minute per user (profileWriteLimiter)

**Response:**
- Success: Returns success message confirming password change
- Error 400: Invalid current password or password requirements not met
- Error 401: Invalid or missing authentication token
- Error 429: Rate limit exceeded

Enable or disable two-factor authentication (2FA) for the user account.

**Authentication Required:** Bearer token

**Request Body:**
- `enable` (required, boolean): Set to `true` to enable 2FA, `false` to disable

**Functionality:**
- When enabled, user will be required to verify OTP during login
- OTP is sent via SMS to user's registered phone number
- Enhances account security by adding second factor verification

**Requirements:**
- User must have a verified phone number to enable 2FA
- Only the account owner can toggle their 2FA setting

**Rate Limiting:** 30 requests per minute per user (profileWriteLimiter)

**Response:**
- Success: Returns updated user profile with new `twoFactorEnabled` status
- Error 400: Missing or invalid enable parameter
- Error 401: Invalid or missing authentication token
- Error 429: Rate limit exceeded

**Use Cases:**
- Enable 2FA for enhanced security before important operations
- Disable 2FA temporarily for easier access during testing

Submit feedback, bug reports, or feature requests.

**Authentication Required:** Bearer token

**Request Body:**
- `message` (required, string): Detailed feedback message
- `rating` (optional, number): Quality/satisfaction rating (1-5 stars)
- `category` (optional, string): Feedback category (default: "other")
  - Valid values: "bug", "feature_request", "improvement", "other"

**Functionality:**
- Feedback is linked to user account for follow-up
- Admins can view all feedback through admin dashboard
- Users can retrieve their own feedback history
- Helps product team improve the application
- Status is automatically set to "pending"

**Rate Limiting:** 30 requests per minute per user (profileWriteLimiter)

**Response:**
- Success: Returns created feedback object with ID, status, and timestamp
- Error 400: Missing required field (message)
- Error 401: Invalid or missing authentication token
- Error 429: Rate limit exceeded

**Best Practices:**
- Provide detailed description for bugs (steps to reproduce, expected vs actual behavior)
- Include specific examples when suggesting improvements
- Use rating to indicate severity or satisfaction level

query.description: Number of items per page (default: 10, max: 100)

request.description:
Retrieve all feedback submitted by the authenticated user.

**Authentication Required:** Bearer token

**Query Parameters:**
- `page` (optional, number): Page number for pagination (default: 1)
- `limit` (optional, number): Items per page (default: 10, max: 100)

**Functionality:**
- Returns all feedback submitted by the current user
- Results are paginated for better performance
- Sorted by creation date (newest first)

**Rate Limiting:** 200 requests per minute per user (readLimiter)

**Response:**
- Success: Returns array of feedback objects with pagination metadata
  - Each feedback includes: id, category, message, rating, status, createdAt, updatedAt
  - Category values: "bug", "feature_request", "improvement", "other"
  - Status values: "pending", "reviewed", "resolved"
  - Rating: 1-5 stars (optional)
  - Pagination: total, page, limit, totalPages, hasNextPage, hasPrevPage
- Error 401: Invalid or missing authentication token
- Error 429: Rate limit exceeded

**Use Cases:**
- Track status of submitted bug reports
- Review previously submitted feature requests
- Check feedback history

Get all feedback with filters (SUPERADMIN only).

**Query Parameters:**
- `page` (optional): Page number (default: 1)
- `limit` (optional): Items per page (default: 10)
- `category` (optional): Filter by category: "bug", "feature_request", "improvement", "other"
- `status` (optional): Filter by status: "pending", "reviewed", "resolved"

**Response includes:**
- Feedback list with populated user details (firstName, lastName, email, role, companyName)
- Pagination metadata
Get feedback statistics (SUPERADMIN only)

Update feedback status (SUPERADMIN only).

**Request Body:**
- `status` (required, string): New status for the feedback
  - Valid values: "pending", "reviewed", "resolved"

**Response:**
Returns updated feedback object with populated user details.

item.name: Team Manager

request.description: Get team manager dashboard statistics
Get leads trend graph for team
Get all leads for team manager's team
Get all team members under this manager
Get leads for a specific team member
Get events managed by this team manager
Get all meetings for team members

variable.description: The ID of the team member

request.description:
Grant calendar permission to a team member, allowing them to connect and use their own Google/Outlook calendar for meeting sync.

**When granted:**
- Member can connect their own Google/Outlook calendar
- Meetings created by the member will sync to THEIR calendar (not team manager's)
- Member gets their own Google Meet / Teams links

**Request Body:**
- `eventId` (required): The event ID to grant calendar permission for

**Response:**
- Returns updated RSVP with `canUseOwnCalendar: true`

variable.description: The ID of the team member

request.description:
Revoke calendar permission from a team member. Their meetings will sync to the team manager's calendar again.

**When revoked:**
- Member can no longer use their own calendar
- Meetings created by the member will sync to TEAM MANAGER's calendar
- Falls back to previous behavior

**Request Body:**
- `eventId` (required): The event ID to revoke calendar permission for

**Response:**
- Returns updated RSVP with `canUseOwnCalendar: false`

item.description: Team manager endpoints for managing team and viewing team performance (TEAMMANAGER only)

item.name: Notifications (Firebase)

request.description: Register a Firebase Cloud Messaging token for the authenticated user. This token will be used to send push notifications to the user's device.
Remove a Firebase Cloud Messaging token from the authenticated user. Use this when user logs out or uninstalls the app.
Get all registered FCM tokens for the authenticated user. Useful for debugging.
Send a test push notification to the authenticated user's registered devices. Useful for testing Firebase setup.

query.description: Filter by priority: low, medium, high (optional)

request.description: Get a paginated list of notifications for the authenticated user. Supports filtering by type, read status, and priority.
Get the count of unread notifications for the authenticated user. Use this for the notification badge.
Mark one or more specific notifications as read. Provide an array of notification IDs in the request body.
Mark all unread notifications as read for the authenticated user. Useful for 'mark all as read' functionality.
Soft delete one or more notifications. Provide an array of notification IDs in the request body. Deleted notifications won't appear in future queries.

item.description: Notification endpoints for managing in-app notifications and Firebase Cloud Messaging push notifications. Includes notification CRUD operations, read/unread tracking, and FCM token management. (Requires authentication)

item.name: Catalogs

request.description: Get available catalog categories (product, service, brochure, pricing, other). Requires TEAMMANAGER role.
Get catalog statistics for team manager dashboard including total catalogs, active/inactive counts, and category breakdown. Requires TEAMMANAGER role.

query.description: Optional: Catalog ID to check which keys are already assigned

request.description: Get all license keys available for catalog assignment. Optionally pass catalogId to see which keys are already assigned. Requires TEAMMANAGER role.

formdata.description: Document files to upload - supports multiple files (PDF, DOC, DOCX, XLS, XLSX, images - max 10MB per file, up to 10 files)
Category: product, service, brochure, pricing, other
Email template as JSON string with subject and body

request.description: Create a new catalog with multiple file uploads, WhatsApp and Email templates. Files are uploaded to S3 and the URLs are stored. Supports up to 10 files per catalog. Available template placeholders: {{leadName}}, {{leadEmail}}, {{leadCompany}}, {{catalogName}}, {{docLink}}, {{eventName}}, {{stallName}}. Requires TEAMMANAGER role.

query.description: Filter by category (product, service, brochure, pricing, other)

request.description: Get all catalogs for the authenticated team manager with pagination and filters. Requires TEAMMANAGER role.
Get a single catalog by ID. Requires TEAMMANAGER role.

formdata.description: New document files to add (optional, supports multiple files - max 10MB per file, up to 10 files total)
JSON array of existing files to keep (optional). Pass empty array [] to remove all existing files. Get current files from GET catalog endpoint.

formdata.value: Hi {{leadName}}, check out our updated catalog: {{docLink}}
{"subject":"Updated {{catalogName}}","body":"Dear {{leadName}},\n\nWe have updated our catalog. View it here: {{docLink}}"}

request.description: Update a catalog. All fields are optional. Upload new files to add to catalog, and use existingFiles to specify which existing files to keep. If existingFiles is provided without new files, only the files in existingFiles array will be kept. At least one file (new or existing) is required. Requires TEAMMANAGER role.
Soft delete a catalog. Requires TEAMMANAGER role.
Assign a catalog to one or more license keys. Team members using these keys can send this catalog to leads. Requires TEAMMANAGER role.
Remove catalog assignment from one or more license keys. Requires TEAMMANAGER role.
Get all catalogs assigned to a specific license key. Used when viewing lead details to show available catalogs to send. Requires TEAMMANAGER or ENDUSER role.
Preview a template with sample data. Returns both original and processed templates. Template type must be 'whatsapp' or 'email'. Requires TEAMMANAGER role.

item.description: Catalog management for team managers. Create, update, and assign catalogs (with WhatsApp/Email templates) to license keys. Team members can then send catalogs to leads. (Requires TEAMMANAGER role)

request.description: Check API health status
